column3: Paul Phua Trial: Illegal Internet Gambling. Macau Trial: Illegal Gambling Operation.
column4: 2008 Royal Malaysia Police report on Phua was erroneous.
column5: The defense lawyers demanded to know why there was little evidence of the video surveillance that could have been put forward by the prosecution, the police officers had no convincing response. They simply said that there had been a major reshuffling of the officers investigating the case over the last five years, from the time of the raid. Phua fought the Vegas case for a year and ultimately emerged practically free of all charges. The prosecutorial ineptitude was a big reason behind this.

column3: USA v. Phua et al. - criminal trial; Paul Phua Trial - criminal trial; Malaysia’s Justice Minister Defends a Gangster - criminal trial; Macau trial - criminal trial.
column5: Trial was postponed pending a federal judge's ruling on whether the FBI improperly entered Las Vegas Strip hotel suites without a warrant before arresting and accusing Paul Phua and his son of illegal Internet gambling. Defense attorneys wanted evidence against the Phuas thrown out. The prosecutorial ineptitude was a big reason behind Phua emerging practically free of all charges.

column3: USA v. Phua et al.: criminal case; Paul Phua Trial: criminal case; Malaysia’s Justice Minister Defends a Gangster: criminal case.
column4: Ahmad Zahid Hamidi wrote that Paul Phua was not a member of the 14K Triad.
column5: Phua fought the Vegas case for a year and ultimately emerged practically free of all charges. The prosecutorial ineptitude was a big reason behind this. Phua can only hope that the Macau trial will yield similar results.
